title.native: フルーツバスケットThe Final

description:
After last season’s revelations, the Soma family moves forward, but the emotional chains that bind them are not easily broken. Unable to admit why she wants the cure, Tohru wrestles with the truth, aware that time is running out for someone close.

And a secret still lurks that could break another’s heart. But hope is not lost—a clue to the curse is found. Could their imprisonment’s end be near?

(Source: Funimation)

Note: This season premiered on Funimation and AnimeLab on March 20, 2021. The Japanese broadcast started two weeks later on April 6, 2021.
hashtag: #フルーツバスケット #フルバ #fruba #furuba
synonyms: เสน่ห์สาวข้าวปั้น ภาค 3
เสน่ห์สาวข้าวปั้น ภาคสุดท้าย

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/n_takaya77)

Natsuki Takaya is a Japanese manga artist best known for creating the series Fruits Basket.

Takaya was born and raised in Tokyo, where she made her debut as a manga artist in 1992. Takaya is left handed and had wanted to be a manga artist since first grade, when her sister started drawing.

__Awards:__
* 2001: Kodansha Manga Award, Shojo : _Fruits Basket_

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/genic_staff)

GENIC is a japanese dance vocal group working under the Avex label since 2019. 

__Members:__
-Mashiko Atsuki (Singer and dancer)
-Nishizawa Joe (Singer and dancer)
-Amemiya Kakeru (Singer and dancer)
-Nishimoto Maiki (Leader, Singer and dancer)
-Kaneya Maria (Singer and dancer)
-Koike Ryuki (Singer and dancer)
-Ui Yurari (Singer and dancer)

[Website](https://avex.jp/warps/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/warpsup_official) | [Weibo](https://www.weibo.com/u/7028502927)

WARPs UP is a chinese-japanese boy band that works under the Avex label since 2019. The name is an acronym that means "Wave Assemble Radical People-syndicate".

__Members:__
-RIKIMARU (Dancer and Singer)
-LANGYI (Dancer and Singer)
-SANTA (Dancer and Singer)
-MINGJUN (Dancer and Singer)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshihide_ibata)

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.
Married to [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/caitlinsvoice) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/caitlinsvoice/) | [Myspace](https://myspace.com/caitlintiffany) | [Blog](https://kiristokyoto.livejournal.com/)

An American voice actor, voice director, and script writer for Funimation, New Generation Pictures, and Bang Zoom! Entertainment. She's been working in the anime industry since 2004. She grew up in the San Diego area, California, and has been married to Tony Patterson since 2009. Outside of voice acting, Caitlin has worked as an ESL teacher in Spain.
Megan Shipman is an American voice actress.
Megan Shipman is an American voice actress.
Megan Shipman is an American voice actress.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NatalieHooverVO)

[Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/kitsunesqueak.bsky.social) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KitsuneSqueak) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/kitsunesqueak/)

Emi Lo is a Taiwanese/Chinese-American voice actor and director.

Non-Anime Roles:
- Ruan Mei - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)

Hope Endrenyi is an American actress and voice actress.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hope_endrenyi/) | [Wiki](https://animevoiceover.fandom.com/wiki/Hope_Endrenyi)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/marchimark) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/jamiemarchi/)

An American voice actress, ADR director, and script writer who works for Funimation and Sentai Filmworks. She grew up in Oklahoma and graduated from the University of Oklahoma with a bachelor's degree in theater, starting her professional acting career in 2000. She married fellow actor Sean T. Perez on August 8, 1999, and they divorced on November 21, 2005. Jamie has two step-daughters. Her younger half-brother, [Jean-Luc Hester](https://anilist.co/staff/104094), is also a voice actor.

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/caitlinsvoice) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/caitlinsvoice/) | [Myspace](https://myspace.com/caitlintiffany) | [Blog](https://kiristokyoto.livejournal.com/)

An American voice actor, voice director, and script writer for Funimation, New Generation Pictures, and Bang Zoom! Entertainment. She's been working in the anime industry since 2004. She grew up in the San Diego area, California, and has been married to Tony Patterson since 2009. Outside of voice acting, Caitlin has worked as an ESL teacher in Spain.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/RiccoFajardo) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/riccofajardo) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCme-D0e9vXL66vUjAbWlpGQ) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/riccofajardo) | [TikTok](https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMJxVroe7/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ricco_Fajardo)

[Twitter](https://x.com/Aaron__Dismuke)

Aaron is an American voice actor who works for anime series of Funimation Entertainment.  He started voice acting when he was nine years old as the voice of Hiro Sohma and the young Akito Sohma in Fruits Basket. He was only twelve years old when he voiced the role of Alphonse Elric in Fullmetal Alchemist, and is a cousin of voice actor and director Justin Cook. Aaron was one of few child voice actors in the voice acting field.  Due to his voice maturing, he was replaced by Maxey Whitehead for his role of Alphonse Elric in Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood, but makes a cameo as the voice of the young Van Hohenheim, Edward and Alphonse's father.
